questions.question:
She was Apollo’s first love but, wishing to remain a virgin forever, she pleaded to her father and was
transformed into a laurel tree.
What sorceress so enchanted Odysseus that he remained on her island of Aeaea for a full year?
Which of the centaurs, the only immortal one, was the wisest of them all?
What young man was the leader of the Quest for the Golden Fleece?

What woman boasted that she was more worthy of praise than Latona because her fourteen
children outnumbered the goddess’ two? She was eventually turned into a weeping rock.
Whose stables at Elis did Heracles have to clean in one day for one of his famous twelve labors?

When Deucalion and Pyrrha asked the oracle of Themis for advice following the great deluge, they
were given which of the following orders:

What river-­‐god did not recognize his daughter, recently transformed into a heifer, until she spelled
out her name on the ground with her hoof?
Who, the eldest of the Pleiades, bore the god Hermes to Zeus?
Which of the following was not one of the Fates?
According to Olen, what goddess of childbirth was the mother of Eros?
During his second labor, Heracles elicited the help of his nephew Iolaus to kill the monstrous Hydr

Who, after being transformed into the constellation Ursa Major, was not allowed to settle below
the horizon by a jealous Juno?
Who was the god of healing and the son of Apollo and Coronis?
Her name is a feminine form of Zeus and, according to Homer, she was the mother of Aphrodite.
She was the muse of epic poetry and the mother of Orpheus.
Together, this couple of deities reared Hera after she was born.

What woman unwittingly sent her husband Alcmaeon to his death when she asked for the infamous
necklace and robe of Harmonia as bridal gifts?

Her father made all her suitors beat him in a chariot race before they could win her hand in
marriage. Pelops eventually di

To which island did Dictys take the chest containing Danae and Perseus? His brother Polydectes was
king here.

What Athenian king was born from the earth and had a man’s body ending in a snake’s tail? He was
the arbiter between Athena and Poseidon for the patronage of Athens.
Which of the following was not one of the Hechatonchires?

He was an offspring of Poseidon and Medusa and the father of Geryon. His name means “Golden
Swor
She was the goddess of victory, daughter of Pallas and Styx, and was a constant companion of Zeus.

Who saw right through Odysseus’ feigned insanity and was able to successfully enlist the Ithacan
king to the Trojan War? Odysseus eventually got his revenge.

What infant child was foolishly left on a bed of parsley by his nurse Hypsipyle while she was showing
the Seven Against Thebes to way to a spring?

What Cretan spirits were entrusted with the care of the infant Zeus? To drown out his cries, they
danced around and clashed their spears and shields.

Which of the Argonauts was so skilled at boxing that he killed the Bebrycian King Amycus with one
blow to the ear?

They were warned by their mother not to fall into the hands of Blackbottom. Eventually, their
thievery was stopped when Zeus transformed them into monkeys.

According to some accounts, to what mortal woman did Zeus give the hound Laelaps as a watchdog
in Crete?
Into what kind of bird was Tereus transformed?

What name is common to a daughter of Deucalion who gave birth to Delphus, eponym of Delphi,
and an unfaithful serving maid of Odysseus and daughter of Dolius?

What woman was kidnapped by Theseus and Pirithous when they determined that they would
marry daughters of Zeus? She was later rescued by her brothers Castor and Pollux.
Which of the following is not associated with the god Hermes?

Before Priam was married to Hecuba, he was married to this woman who bore a son, Aesacus. Who
was this lesser known wife of Priam?

She was first carried off by Achilles after her husband, parents, and brothers were killed during a
Greek invasion. Later, she was taken by Agamemnon and became his concubine for some time. Give the
more common name for this unfortunate girl from Lyrnessus, whose real name was Hippodami

His only claim to fame is that he reared the Chimaera, the fire-­‐breathing monster that ravaged Lycia
and was eventually killed by Bellerophon.
Who are the parents of Eumelus, the husband of Penelope’s sister Iphthime?
What epithet of Dionysus means “Thunderer”?

During the Gigantomachy, which of the giants was killed after Apollo shot an arrow into his left eye
and Heracles shot one into his right?
Under what name did Demeter wander into the palace of Celeus at Eleusis?

What mountain supposedly contained a cave which was the haven of the infant Zeus? This
mountain was also said to be the home of the Harpies.

Where was Nestor when all of his siblings and his father Neleus were killed by Heracles? Some say
he was raised and educated here.

What king became the first man to murder a family member when he killed his father-­‐in-­‐law
Eioneus?

To what mythological group do the following belong: Erytheia, Hestia, Aegle, and Arethusa? This
group showed the Argonauts a spring that Heracles had once create

When Poseidon lost to Hera in the competition for the patronage of Argos, he left the land destitute
of water. When Danaus arrived with his fifty daughters, he sent some of them to find water. Which of
this group of sisters, tired by the search, fell asleep by the wayside and woke up, terrified, to the sight of
a satyr trying to ravish her?

When Dionysus intended to retrieve his mother from the Underworld, what native guide agreed to
show the god the route only if he would lie with him?

She was a daughter of Oceanus and, together with the Telchines, she brought up the infant
Poseidon on the island of Rhodes.

According to Book II of Ovid’s Metamorphoses, this old man observed Hermes stealing cattle from
Apollo. Hermes ordered him to not tell anyone what he had seen but, not trusting him, the god returned
in disguise and asked the old man where the cattle went, promising a reward in return. When this old
man told him what he saw, Hermes revealed himself and punished this man by turning him to stone.

According to legend, what Titan saved his mother Ge from the wrath of Zeus by producing a fig tree
under which she could take shelter from the Zeus’ thunderbolts?
